> > Subject: Headaches & Antidepressants

> > Content-Type: text/plain;
> > charset="iso-8859-1"
> > Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
> >
> > I know more than one person who has had migraine problems..going even to
=
> > the extremists extent and going to pain management where they =
> > prescribe....highly addictive narcotics...like Morphine, which does more
=
> > damage to her in the long run, than the migraines limit her...and being
=
> > in a fetal position in severe pain..does sometimes cause one to be =
> > depressed....and moody. What I have found is that western medicine =
> > tends to mask the initiator problem, and then causes more problems , =
> > having many side effects, and long term effects that they are not aware
=
> > of, because that's not what they were testing for... with these new =
> > mangled fangled....miracle cures...rather than look for or find the root
=
> > problem of the migraines...they treat the symptom, never touching the =
> > actual problem........therefor healing never takes place, only part time
=
> > relief..and as with anything.....like the natural flow of energy...there
=
> > is ebb and flow..ebb & flow..a motion......when you hold something that
=
> > is in motion on a steady keel..it may not show any symptons...but is =
> > nature is still in motion..you can not hold it forever..eventually it =
> > will begin motion again..either making a higher ebb or deeper =
> > flow......more or less severe migraines.....but you can not hold =
> > something in limbo forever......and when I'm looking at or facing =
> > disease....I begin with the cause...if I can..or I begin with the symtom
=
> > and work my way back to the cause....there are various natural remedies,
=
> > known to do little or no harm to the body ...and when something is in =
> > it's wholest state it gives nourishing whole effects....I'd look under =
> > natural medicine......each person is different and you will need to find
=
> > what works best for you....but the process educates, and allows you to =
> > take part in your health care, and know more about the sources of things
=
> > that we take in....One last note on antidepressants....they release =
> > certain chemicals in the brain that allow someone to feel better, please
=
> > remember that these are naturally occuring chemicals that are already in
=
> > the brain..their ability to be released at the appropriate time has been
=
> > somehow cut-off..what is the most common factor to cut off the brain's =
> > ability to release the chemicals naturally????drugs that make the brain
=
> > dependant to release them...in other words things such as =
> > antidepressants. Michelle =20
> >
